H0.text: Milk is considered a good source of calcium.

H1.text: Wheat is considered a good source of calcium.

H2.text: Egg is considered a good source of calcium.

H3.text: Corn is considered a good source of calcium.

A4.text: One cup (250 mL) of 2%-fat cow's milk contains 285 mg of calcium, which represents 22% to 29% of the daily recommended intake (DRI) of calcium for an adult.

A5.text: Bovine milk contains a variety of cations and anions traditionally referred to as minerals or milk salts. Calcium, phosphate, magnesium, sodium, potassium, citrate, and chloride are all included and they typically occur at concentrations of 5â€“40 mM.
